c74object.name: fl.wrap~
c74object.digest: Wraps the incoming frame into the range delimited by the two parameters.
c74object.description: Calculation is performed on triplets of values in turn. The output is a frame at least as long as the leftmost frame. If inputs mismatch in length the result depends on the mismatch parameter.

entry.name: /mismatch [instantiation enum]
entry.description:
Sets the mode used when dealing with mismatched input lengths:
wrap - smaller right inputs are read modulo against larger left input.
shrink - the output length is set to the length of the smaller input.
extend - smaller right inputs are extended by repeating their final value.
[0] - wrap [1] - shrink [2] - extend

objarg.name: parameter-1
objarg.digest: The value to use for input 2 if it is disconnected
objarg.description: Sets a single value for fl.wrap~

objarg.name: parameter-2
objarg.digest: The value to use for input 3 if it is disconnected
objarg.description: Sets a single value for fl.wrap~

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.wrap~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

method.name: frame
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

method.name: sync
method.description: Used internally by FrameLib's connection routines. User messages have no effect.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.wrap~. When set to 0 fl.wrap~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.wrap~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
